question.text: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mfenced close="]" open="["><mrow><mi>Ti</mi><msub><mfenced><mrow><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow></mfenced><mn>6</mn></msub></mrow></mfenced><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math> absorbs light of wavelength <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>498</mn><mo> </mo><mi>nm</mi></math> during a <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mo>-</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi></math> transition. The octahedral splitting energy for the above complex is _______ <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>19</mn></mrow></msup><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>. (Round off to the Nearest Integer). <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">h</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>626</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>34</mn></mrow></msup><mo> </mo><mi>Js</mi><mo>;</mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>8</mn></msup><msup><mrow><mo> </mo><mi>ms</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>.

solution.text:
λabsorbed=498 nm (given)

The octahedral splitting energy 

Δ0 or E=hcλ

=0.0399×10-17 J

=3.99×10-19 J

=4.00×10-19 J   (round off)
